header.title: CPU Scheduler
header.subtitle: CPU Scheduler Simulator
header.description: Visualize the main CPU scheduling algorithms in real time. Build your ready queue, configure the quantum and follow each executed time slice.

main.title: Interactive Learning Experience
main.subtitle: Dive deep into operating system concepts with hands-on simulation
main.description: Explore the fundamentals of operating systems through interactive visualizations and real-time scheduling algorithms.

errors.noProcesses: Add at least one process to start the simulation.
errors.invalidQuantum: Enter a quantum greater than zero for Round Robin.

helpers.quickTips: Use the timeline slider to navigate through executed steps and observe process evolution.|Try different quantum values in Round Robin to see how waiting time and step count change.
helpers.aboutDescription: This interface uses the scheduling engine ported directly from the open-source C project <link>PrjtCpuSch</link>, enabling real-time visualization of each process state.

fcfs.title: First-Come, First-Served (FCFS)
fcfs.description: Executes processes sequentially following their arrival order in the ready queue.
fcfs.hints: Waiting time can be high for long-running processes.|No preemption occurs during execution.

rr.title: Round Robin
rr.description: Distributes CPU time in fixed slices (quantum) while rotating among processes.
rr.hints: Ideal for time-sharing systems.|Processes return to the end of the queue if they do not finish within the quantum.

priority.title: Priority Queue
priority.description: Processes are organized into queues by priority (1 = highest). Each queue runs FCFS.
priority.hints: Lower-priority processes wait for higher queues to empty.|Useful for scenarios with different service levels.
priority.requirements: Priority from 1 to 5 for each process.

sjf.title: Shortest Job First
sjf.description: Selects the process with the smallest remaining CPU time for completion.
sjf.hints: Minimizes average waiting time when durations are known.|Non-preemptive variant.
sjf.requirements: Estimated CPU time for each process.

processList.title: Input processes
processList.subtitle: Provide the required CPU time and priority (1-5).

timeline.title: Step-by-step execution
timeline.subtitle: Track each executed quantum and the current state of every process.
timeline.empty: Run a simulation to visualize the results.
